content.description: Same Start as Swiss High in the obvious low hueco. Traverse left through poor feet and sharp pockets to the same Hueco finish. Any holds at or above the bulge are off.
content.location: Far right side of Left of the Bow before the obvious the slab wash and obvious arete.

content.description: Starts in the low obvious Hueco on poor feet. Traverse up and left, following good hand hold over the bulge. Continue left across poor feet with good hands into the Hueco.
content.location: Far right side of Left of the Bow before the slab wash and obvious arete of the wall.

content.description: Crux is likely the lower traverse, or the high left hand crimp next to the pinch. Stops at the good ledge at 12 feet
content.location: Same traverse start as Chimera. Start standing on the slabs, and traverse right across the obvious bulge. From the jug just past the bulge head straight up to a poor left hand crimp and a right hand pinch. Finish at the ledge.

content.description: Sit start on the two low left edges. Break right to the crimp, then straight up through the poor dish to the top of the wall.
content.location: Left of The Beholder on Left of the Bow.

content.description: Great warm up, multiple exits. Crux is the last few moves to the ledge.
content.location: Start far lady standing on the slabs, traverse right around obvious bulge, and continue to a good right hand crimp right before the holds become much more difficult. Head straight up to the finish ledge.

content.description: Start on the good ledge, break right into laybacks up into a good hueco. Finish at the ledge above.
content.location: Largest hueco Left of The Bow right in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Pretty consistent, easy intro climb. Straight up  and break right 12 feet to the ledge. Should have a decent left hand side pull and great feet. Top out right side of the pocketed indentation.
content.location: Shares start with Chimera and Purple Rain. Head straight up good holds to the ledge around 12 ft.

content.description: Start shared with Baby Steps, but head up and left to the obvious Hueco. Continue up and left to top out on ledge at 12 feet.
content.location: Far left on Left of The Bow. Shares start with Baby Steps. Breaks up and left instead of up and slight right.

content.description: Start off on the ledge and head straight up. The side pull is a right hand Gaston that will lead you straight up through the pocketed hueco feature. Great feet.
content.location: Shared start with BSL and BSR. Left most established line Left of the Bow.

content.description: A good variation of small crimps and some powerful moves. Traverses create some great longer problems.
